etymologies: early 18th century (in the sense ‘drawing room’): from French salon, from Italian salone ‘large hall’, augmentative of sala ‘hall’

definitions: a public room or building used for a specified purpose
shortDefinitions: public room or building used for specified purpose

definitions: a place where alcoholic drinks may be bought and drunk.
shortDefinitions: place where alcoholic drinks may be bought and drunk

definitions: a large public room for use as a lounge on a ship.
shortDefinitions: large public room for use as lounge on ship

definitions: a luxurious railroad car used as a lounge or restaurant or as private accommodations
shortDefinitions: luxurious railway carriage used as lounge or restaurant

definitions: an automobile having a closed body and a closed trunk separated from the part in which the driver and passengers sit; a sedan
shortDefinitions: car having closed body and closed boot separated from part in which driver and passengers sit
